name: Rep. Colin Allred
tweets:
['We have to do whatever we can to save lives. Inaction is not an option.

Watch my interview with @WolfBlitzer on @CNNSitRoom. https://t.co/hQpg8W0LCJ', 'An important update from @POTUS’s Operation Fly Formula: another big shipment is on its way, this time to Ft. Worth for distribution across the country. The work continues to help parents get the formula they need to feed their babies.
https://t.co/A2uPFyOLVz', 'Anything that will save lives, we have to do. This week, the House will pass common-sense gun safety measures, but we still need 10 Republicans in the Senate to join us.

We must break the ice and get something done to save lives.

Watch my interview with @jdbalart. https://t.co/4FbN0BQ4ZC', "Texas is home to some of the brightest research minds and bringing @POTUS's proposed biomedical research program ARPA-H to the Lone Star State would position Texas as a leader in the field. https://t.co/xhcbWznqmN', 'I refuse to accept that nothing can be done to solve the crisis of gun violence. I #WearOrange today because as we honor the lives of those taken from us by gun violence, I refuse to believe there is nothing we can do to prevent these tragedies.

The time for action is now. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/41NtGwHL6N']

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweets:

name: Rep. Peter DeFazio
tweets: ['RT @USProgressives: BREAKING: A bipartisan group of nearly 50 members of Congress just introduced legislation to invoke constitutional war…', 'Congress cannot sit by and allow the United States’ complicity to continue in the worst humanitarian crisis in the world. It’s beyond time to assert Congress’s constitutional war powers and end unauthorized U.S. military involvement this war. (4/4) https://t.co/aqpfiYbsuZ', 'For over 7 years, unauthorized U.S. involvement & support of the brutal Saudi-led offensive and has helped create the worst humanitarian crisis in the world. 16 million Yemenis are living on the brink of starvation, including 2 million children. (3/4)', 'Article I of the Constitution & U.S. law are clear: Congress, not the President, has the sole authority to declare war and authorize U.S. involvement in overseas hostilities. For too long, presidents of both parties have bypassed Congress to engage in endless foreign wars. (2/4)', 'Today I’m proud to introduce a new bipartisan Yemen War Powers Resolution and stand with my colleagues @RepJayapal, @RepAdamSchiff, and @RepNancyMace in calling for an end to unauthorized U.S. military involvement in the war in Yemen.\xa0(1/4)', 'This #MemorialDay and every day, we thank those who gave their lives for our nation. The Senate must take action now on the House-passed bipartisan gun safety legislation that would help save lives.', 'As the only certified bike mechanic in Congress, I love #BikeToWorkDay!\nAs Chair of @TransportDems, it’s been a top priority for me to invest in our nation’s bike and pedestrian infrastructure, which not only makes communities more connected, but also prevents harmful pollution. https://t.co/JVSVZTOvOv', 'Oil companies’ price gouging and market manipulation has led to record oil profits and record high fuel prices at the pump. name: Rep. Diana DeGette
tweets:
['BREAKING: Our legislation to ban high-capacity gun magazines just passed the Judiciary committee & now heads to the full House for a vote.
\xa0
Experts agree banning these magazines will help save lives. It’s one of the many things we need to do better protect our communities.', 'We need to:

- Reinstate the nationwide ban on assault weapons
- Ban high-capacity magazines
- Strengthen our system of background checks

I have sponsored legislation to do all of those things & we need to get them signed into law as soon as possible.', 'Happy Pride Month! 🌈
\xa0
Let’s celebrate the LGBTQ+ community and the progress that we’ve made. Let’s also recommit ourselves to doing even more to make our country a more just, equal and inclusive place for everyone.', 'The House will vote next week on EIGHT gun-safety bills – including the legislation @RepTedDeutch and I introduced to ban high-capacity magazines that hold more than 10 rounds.', 'Today, we honor all those who made the ultimate sacrifice for our nation. Their courage and selflessness is why we are able to enjoy the freedom and security we have today. We owe them a debt we can never repay.', 'There are more guns in this country than people.
\xa0
There are more mass shootings in the U.S. than any other developed country in the world.
\xa0
Those two things are not unrelated.', 'There were 19 fully armed officers standing in the hall waiting for backup as kids were being slaughtered by someone with an assault rifle.

NINETEEN(!) good guys with guns couldn’t save them from one bad guy with an assault weapon. 

We need to get these weapons off our streets!', "We can't continue to live in a world where those intent on causing us harm can casually walk into a store to pick up a weapon of war & slaughter innocent children.
 
We need to ban assault weapons & high-capacity magazines in this country right now!", 'Modeled after DARPA, this new agency will be asked to make the impossible, possible.
\xa0
Now, we just need to pass our legislation to give it the tools and resources it needs to succeed.', 'The Biden Administration just unveiled its first steps to make ARPA-H a reality.
\xa0
This is a huge moment in our effort to create this new advanced research agency that will be tasked with curing some of the most difficult diseases – such as cancer, diabetes, Alzheimer’s & more!']

name: John Garamendi
tweets:
['Republicans are hoping that you and I let Uvalde become just another mass shooting. We won’t allow that. That’s why this week I will vote for:
• A ban on bump stocks
• Bans on high capacity magazines
• Raising the age of gun purchases to 21
• Red flag purchase restrictions', 'As we commemorate their work let us continue to fight their fight — the fight to repudiate authoritarianism, white nationalism, and nazism at every turn.', '78 years ago, the bravest men in the US military risked life and limb to storm the beaches of Normandy, freeing Europe from Nazi oppression. Today we recognize their contributions to freedom and democracy along with their role in ending the genocidal regime of the Third Reich. https://t.co/fNO6ypFJ0f', 'Gun reforms are exceedingly popular — yet a small clique of radical politicians funded by the gun lobby prevents their passing at every turn. It’s time for that to change. https://t.co/dMyrIvSJaY', 'I’m choosing our children and a safe future over the radical NRA agenda. That’s why next week I will vote for common-sense gun reforms and continue my decades-long efforts to prevent mass shootings. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/oGc8wWFZFR', 'The simple answer is the correct one, Congress needs to pass an assault weapons ban. We saw a dramatic decrease in mass shootings we had a federal assault weapons ban from 1994-2004, and we will see another decrease in shootings if we reinstate it today.', 'The gunman purchased his rifle that same day, and had purchased a handgun four days ago. If he had faced any restriction on that purchase four Americans could still be with us today. Instead, he walked into a gun store and walked with the ability to carry out a mass shooting.', 'Yesterday a lone gunman walked up to a hospital in Tulsa Oklahoma and opened fire. At least four people lost their lives, several others suffered physical injuries, and an untold number will have lasting psychological damage for years to come.', 'Let’s dispense with the lies. Republicans only talk about mental healthcare when it’s time to protect the NRA. They only want to address mental health as a deflection from common-sense gun reform. We need to get assault weapons off our streets and fund mental health treatment. https://t.co/ZrvPjJ0Kyy', 'Happy Pride Month! Let’s celebrate the LGBTQ+ community and the progress we have made towards LGBTQ+ equality while reaffirming our support for LGBTQ+ individuals and our commitment to uplifting their voices across the country. #PrideMonth https://t.co/eG13olrfph']

name: Rep. Dan Kildee

name: Congresswoman Kathy Manning
tweets:
['In 2022, there have been over 240 mass shootings in the US. We can’t allow this senseless gun violence to continue. 

In Congress, I’ve supported common sense gun safety legislation. I’m calling on the Senate to do the same.

https://t.co/odbNEwngLT', 'ATTN: Forsyth County’s Covid-19 level has been upgraded to high. For high Covid-19 levels, the CDC recommends that everyone wear fitted masks indoors and stay up-to-date on Covid-19 vaccines and boosters. Read more below ⬇

It was my pleasure to tour the Center and see the incredible work they do to support those who served our country. https://t.co/G6VqNcflcT', 'The May jobs report shows our economy added 390,000 new jobs, and unemployment remained at 3.6% - a pandemic low. 

Thanks to the passage of the #AmericanRescuePlan, we continue to see a historic economic recovery from the initial impacts of the pandemic.
https://t.co/2drlRDZzhk', 'Today on National Gun Violence Awareness Day, I #WearOrange in remembrance of the lives lost to senseless gun violence, stand with the survivors, families, and loved ones that have been impacted, and call for immediate action to #EndGunViolence. https://t.co/ra4DJMGcHH', 'I hosted a veterans round table which brought veterans, veterans service organizations, and local leaders together to share ideas and solutions to challenges many veterans face. More than 15,000 veterans live in #NC06 – I’m proud to be their voice in DC. https://t.co/bnB2xnjH9j', 'It was my pleasure to join @NCCHCAOnline in touring Winston-Salem’s United Health Centers today. United Health Centers is one of three federally-supported community care centers in #NC06, providing primary care to our most vulnerable communities. https://t.co/eYqpXc6DVd', 'Following the leak of a draft opinion, it appears that the Supreme Court is poised to overturn Roe vs. Wade, taking away the constitutional right to obtain an abortion.

Please complete this survey to share your thoughts on abortion access. 
https://t.co/sFPjgJWDNt', 'In 2022, there have already been over 200 mass shootings in the United States.

This #GunViolenceAwarenessMonth, we recognize the heartbreaking toll gun violence takes on our communities and recommit to passing common sense gun safety legislation to #EndGunViolence. https://t.co/FWJCpwPdvp']

name: Rep. Doris Matsui
tweets:
['Happy #Pride Month! 🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍⚧️
 
I’m proud to stand with the LGBTQIA+ community in Sacramento and across the country — and I’ll continue to work hard in Congress to fight for the rights of all those who love who they love and who are living their most authentic lives. https://t.co/PbqXBGJ47b', 'No child should ever be scared to go to school. People shouldn’t fear simply going to the grocery store or out to dinner. Continue to be loud. Continue to push for legislation that makes a difference. We can always do more — and let’s continue pushing for change together.', 'This week, the House began to consider the Protecting our Kids Act — which would raise the lawful age to purchase assault weapons to 21, ban ghost guns, and strengthen storage requirements.', 'These mass shootings are utterly heartbreaking. But the more shootings we experience, the more my Republican colleagues in Congress dig in against taking real action to address this epidemic. I know here in Sacramento, & across California we do not accept this violence as normal.', 'Today on #WearOrange Day, I called for immediate action to address the gun violence epidemic in our country. Recently, our community was devastated by the deadliest shooting in Sacramento’s history. Last week, a lone gunman took the lives of innocent children & teachers in Texas. https://t.co/nW81Xmg4gJ', 'As we #WearOrange to honor the victims and survivors of gun violence today, I join in urging the Senate to advance House-passed gun legislation supported by a bipartisan majority of Americans. 

We cannot simply accept these incidents are normal. We must #EndGunViolence now. https://t.co/KFAhRNZtTL', 'RT @officialSCUSD: Thank you to Congresswoman @DorisMatsui who presented an American flag that was flown over the U.S. Capitol to Father Ke…', "It was wonderful presenting Father Keith B. Kenny Elementary School students, teachers, & staff with a new flag that has flown over the U.S. Capitol! 🇺🇸

I'm honored to represent them in Washington, DC, & thank you to the @CityYearSAC volunteers for assisting in raising the flag! https://t.co/QUE28s6osc", 'On #MemorialDay, we honor our brave servicemembers and families who made the ultimate sacrifice to defend our country and our freedoms.
 
Even after today ends, may we share their stories and uphold our promise to take care of our veterans when they return home. https://t.co/yv3RiqzuDn', 'I am heartbroken and outraged at the horrific news from Robb Elementary. 19 innocent children were taken from us. Another community has been torn apart. 

We send our heartfelt support and mourn the lives that have been taken far too soon. But we must all demand action.']

name: Rep. Lucy McBath
tweets:
['As a two-time breast cancer survivor, this day is special to me. National Cancer Survivors Day is an opportunity to celebrate the courage, strength, and resilience of cancer survivors. #NCSD2022

To my fellow fighters, I’m sending you extra love today. 💪❤️', 'We #WearOrange for the kids scared in our schools. An entire generation of children is learning that the adults they look up to cannot—or will not—protect them.

We are facing the challenge of our lifetime and the issue of our era. @HouseDemocrats are acting to save lives. https://t.co/TTXObJ4hUE', '"Was my child afraid?

Did he feel pain as the bullets ripped through his skin?

How long did it take him to die?

Was it quick, or did he suffer?" https://t.co/Yh9IuzSoBR', 'On #MemorialDay, we honor service members from all walks of life, of every race, and every creed who made the ultimate sacrifice for our country in defense of the ideals of our nation.

I am forever grateful for their bravery and service. https://t.co/1mHFpSZDJX', 'We have to do something to fix this. We can do something to help fix this. We must do something to keep guns out of the hands of those who should not have them.

It’s imperative we act, and act now. I will never rest until we do.', 'We are better than this.

We have to be better than this.

We cannot be the only nation where we pay for the weapons of war in our streets with the blood of our children sitting in our schools.', 'At a time when this nation is still reeling from the pain of recent shootings, we are faced with another sickening, preventable tragedy in Texas.', 'Again in America, more families will now be forced to live forever with the pain of losing their precious children to unspeakable, senseless gun violence in a place where they should have been safe, happy, and free.', 'Veterans have sacrificed so much for our country, and we must continue doing all we can to serve them and their families. I was proud to help Raul and Marge when they needed it most. https://t.co/z3tmPwMrHW', 'From the time I could walk, I was marching with my family—fighting for equality & calling for justice. I was raised by my parents to always fight for what is right & what is just. My parents taught me to stand so that every American’s voice is heard & their vote is counted. https://t.co/ZVPyrxezAL']

name: Jerry McNerney
tweets:
['House Democrats’ work to #EndGunViolence through common-sense gun legislation will help build better, safer lives for our nation’s children. https://t.co/Y409bvvdFO', 'One week ago, 19 children and 2 adults lost their lives in the worst elementary school shooting since Sandy Hook.

Today, we honor victims of gun violence by remembering the lives they lived and recommitting to #EndGunViolence.', 'Today, we honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice in defense of our country and of our founding ideals.

#MemorialDay2022 https://t.co/VrVwNnVGzS', 'RT @POTUS: The idea that an 18-year-old can walk into a store and buy assault weapons is just wrong.

What in God’s name do you need an ass…', 'Gun violence is the leading cause of death among children. In 2020, 4,357 children were shot and killed, and these numbers are trending upward across the country. I will stand up for America’s children and keep fighting for #gunviolenceprevention.', 'Anyone who refuses to vote for sensible ways to stop gun violence in order to protect their seat in Congress is guilty of a grave moral transgression and should not be allowed to serve this nation.', 'Republicans will say, let’s not use this tragedy for political purposes. But this isn’t political, it’s a matter of life and death. After Sandy Hook, after today, there must be accountability.', 'And this is on the heels of two other tragic mass shootings, one in Buffalo and one in California. The Republican Party feels it is their duty to protect gun rights. But what about the rights of children, the rights of those innocent people who have been gunned down?', 'The most profound duty of parents and adults is to provide the safety and security of their children. This terrible shooting in Texas today violated that trust. Our society has abandoned its responsibility to children.', 'A group of students from McCaffrey Middle School in Galt were visiting DC last week. They stopped by the Capitol to chat and had some great questions about issues impacting our region and other areas around the world. https://t.co/eABn15V3wY']

name: Grace Meng

Discussed issues concerning local residents and provided COVID-19 test kits, sanitizer, PPE and information about constituent assistance and federal programs. #Queens https://t.co/tXakRQbsuX', 'Members of my team had a wonderful time celebrating #QueensPride today. We thank you for joining our fight to combat the ongoing hate and violence against #AsianAmericans. https://t.co/JnGs6gHKV7', 'This includes improving the collection of hate crime data, better guidance for hate crime investigations, developing anti-bias programming and removing barriers to reporting of hate incidents. https://t.co/rhMcgGeash  3/3', 'My COVID-19 Hate Crimes Act that the @TheJusticeDept is implementing, and is one component to combating the problem, works to address many of the report’s recommendations. 2/3']

name: Kweisi Mfume
tweets: ['Thank you, Rev. Sharpton and your entire team @PoliticsNation for giving me the opportunity to speak on these issues. I look forward to joining you again soon. #PoliticsNation', 'We wrapped up our talks discussing what to expect from the January 6 committee and their public hearings that will begin this week. https://t.co/fn9i3ESixH', 'Reverend Sharpton and I then spoke on a recent Washington Post (@washingtonpost) piece signaling decreased support for the president from African American voters. https://t.co/ofJtuu4PlB', 'We began our conversation with a discussion on President Biden’s (@POTUS) call for congressional action on gun reform, our efforts in Congress to bring forth gun violence prevention legislation, and if the president should utilize further executive orders to address this crisis. https://t.co/UiwX7KkWp8', 'Yesterday evening, I had the great pleasure to speak with Reverend Al Sharpton (@TheRevAl) on PoliticsNation (@PoliticsNation), which he hosts on MSNBC (@MSNBC).', 'I remain committed to working in Congress for legislation that will put a stop to this crisis and save lives.  #WearOrange #NationalGunViolenceAwarenessDay  #GunViolenceAwarenessMonth @everytown\n@momsdemand @bmoreceasefire @erricka', 'As we enter the month of June and Gun Violence Awareness Month, we continue to be reminded of the devastating harm the epidemic of gun violence has on our nation.', 'Today, I am wearing orange to recognize National Gun Violence Awareness Day, honor survivors of gun violence, and keep those we have lost near to our hearts. https://t.co/OrKtbjI2Oa', 'Thank you again, Wallace, for an exceptional career.', 'Wallace is retiring, and I wish him a restful retirement spending time with his family, watching the Ravens and Orioles, and pursuing his passions for painting and art.']

The economy is growing because @POTUS and Democrats are meeting the needs of working people.', 'To those who call for thoughts and prayers after a shooting:

name: Rep. Chris Pappas
tweets:

name: Nancy Pelosi
tweets:
['Let us honor these brave warriors by carrying on their fight against tyranny and ensuring that the flame of democracy continues to light our path forward for generations to come.', 'As we mark 78 years since the Allied D-Day landings, Americans and all freedom-loving people remain in awe of the heroes who stormed the beaches of Normandy to free millions from the clutches of fascism and return the flame of democracy to Europe. https://t.co/XXIS7O5SEq', "In the middle of Putin's war on democracy, oil & gas companies continue to reap record profits & take advantage of the crisis by giving $41 billion to shareholders. https://t.co/Dw9qgD21gg', 'We must never be silent on issues of freedom, dignity and democracy – because if we do not speak out against human rights abuses in China due to commercial interests, then we will lose all moral authority to speak out for human rights anywhere else in the world.', 'As we commemorate the heroism of the Tiananmen generation, each of us has a sacred obligation to build a more just, more equal and more democratic future.', 'As the world honors the courage of students, workers and ordinary citizens who peacefully defied the Chinese Communist Party’s oppressive regime, let us renew our vow to keep alive the flame of freedom that burned in their hearts.', 'Today, the image of a lone figure – unyielding before a line of tanks – remains seared in the memory of all democracy-loving people.']

name: Adam Schiff
tweets:
['The Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia ordered the brutal murder of an American resident and journalist, Jamal Khashoggi.

For that — and many other human rights violations — he should be shunned.

I would not meet with him or shake his hand.

President Biden shouldn’t either. https://t.co/FSuRT2iK2O', 'January 6 was the violent culmination of an extensive effort to overturn a presidential election.

The American people know a lot about those events, but soon they will learn more, and see how close we came to losing our democracy.

On Thursday, we will begin to tell that story. https://t.co/hX6RAS9GFR', 'Prosecution of those who refuse to comply with a lawful subpoena is vital to ensuring congressional oversight has teeth.

Otherwise, Congress cannot function as the Founders intended.

The balance of power becomes unbalanced. And a corrupt executive can’t be held to account.', ".@POTUS' strategy to fight gun violence is spot on.

One of his priorities: Repealing immunity for negligent gun makers and dealers.

That’s a top priority of mine, too.

And I wrote the bill to get it done.

No one gets a pass when it comes to protecting the lives of our kids.", 'Same old excuses from the GOP:

“Criminals will break any gun safety laws we pass.”

Wrong. Gun laws reduce the number of mass killings.

They have in every other country that has tried.

We’re lawmakers. It’s literally in the job title.

If you’re not up to it, find a new job.', 'It just never ends.

And how could we expect it to if we don’t do anything about gun violence.

My heart is with the Tulsa community as it mourns.

But my determination is in Washington where every wasted second means another preventable death.

We must act. Now.', 'Pride is a time to uplift the LGBTQ+ community.

To do so, we must remember its roots.

Because the first Pride wasn’t a celebration – it was a protest led by trans activists like Marsha P. Johnson and Sylvia Rivera.

We honor them by standing with the LGBTQ+ community. Always.', "I just introduced a bill to suspend the federal gas tax.

To deliver savings for the millions of families struggling to get by.

We’ll pay for it with a tax on the excess profits of Big Oil companies.

It's time they paid their fair share - and you got a break at the pump.", 'On Memorial Day, we honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice in service of their country.

Our nation is safer and stronger today because of the heroes who serve it in uniform.

So to all those who serve, and to their families and loved ones: Thank you.', 'Many of us got involved in politics because we wanted to leave a better world behind.

We still can.

But not if we lack courage. 

Or give in to despair.

I’m not giving up.

You must not either.']

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweets:
['Thanks to $2 million from the American Rescue Plan, Prospect Heights homeowners can rest assured that rain will not lead to costly flood damage. Thank you to city officials for inviting me Friday to the groundbreaking ceremony for the Arlington Countryside Stormwater Project. https://t.co/ATt5NMMs2r', 'I extend my personal condolences to John’s family and pray that his example of civility, leadership and public service can be a model for what Congress can do when it operates at its best. May his memory be a blessing.', 'I will forever remember the wise counsel he provided in 2013 as the government was about to shut down, advice I have carried with me throughout my time serving Illinois’s 10th District, as he did for so long.', 'Though we are of different parties, John immediately reached out to me when I first took office, and was a valued advisor and friend.', 'He was an extraordinary advocate for the National Institutes of Health, which named its Neuroscience Research Center in recognition of his decades of dedication. \xa0He was also a remarkable leader in defending human rights around the world.', 'Sad to learn of the passing of former 10th District Representative John Porter. \xa0John was a dedicated public servant who understood that progress was best achieved by working with, rather than against, others. 

https://t.co/RZWSHI1c5O', 'On Gun Violence Prevention Day, the Lake County family came together to say enough to the rise in violence. We celebrated new funding for the County Gun Violence Prevention Initiative. Thanks to the American Rescue Plan, $560,000 is being put to work securing our communities. https://t.co/CMYZxcdJRj', 'It was an honor to join the Society of American Military Engineers - Lake Michigan Post for their annual luncheon discussing the important infrastructure projects happening throughout Northeastern Illinois. https://t.co/zZwIRgar91', 'Every one of these kids could be our kids. 

https://t.co/rgvWPHl48j', 'I join the Administration’s deep concern about the decision of the Iraqi Parliament.  The Abraham Accords represent a tremendous opportunity to improve the lives of the people of the Middle East and foster peace and security for the region. https://t.co/fAWSP5JqpH']

name: Rep. Kurt Schrader
tweets:
['In addition @POTUS invoked the Defense Production Act to ramp up domestic production of infant formula & has started shipping in formula from abroad. Together these actions will help ensure Oregon families can better access safe, affordable infant formula.

Last week, Congress passed funding to ensure @US_FDA has the necessary resources to address the supply status and took up legislation to improve WIC participants’ access to formula.', "The needs of the workforce are changing & it is crucial that workers can gain the skills and training necessary to succeed. I voted for legislation that will invest in the nation's workforce development system, expand economic opportunity, and increase access to good paying jobs. https://t.co/QZ5FNU27FU", 'I am closely monitoring the infant formula supply status, and will continue to work to ensure Oregon families can access safe, affordable infant formula and nutrition products. Info about how to obtain formula, food bank locations, and more here. ⬇
https://t.co/98GhyLI1zX', 'Communities must be equipped with the tools they need to lift families out of poverty. Today, I voted to pass bipartisan legislation that will deliver resources to local community organizations across #OR05 who help secure employment, education, and housing for Oregonians. https://t.co/FhXlC79RgA', 'Today, I voted to support #RightsForTheTSAWorkforce by ensuring these 60,000 frontline workers have the same basic workplace protections as the rest of the federal government including regular pay increases, collective bargaining rights, and independent appeal resolution. https://t.co/LkD9SLeaLW', 'As we approach wildfire season it is imperative that our firefighting workforce is adequately paid for their work. The ability to respond safely, quickly, & effectively to wildfires is critical to the safety of Oregonians & pay is essential to staffing. Proud to join this effort! https://t.co/8bnt0ARBJw', '#FederalFirefighters risk their lives for the safety of our communities, and it is our duty to make sure they can get the care and services they have earned.', 'Federal firefighters and EMS personnel make significant sacrifices and take incredible risks in service to their communities. I voted to ensure that these brave first responders have access to the same workers compensation and health benefits as other professional firefighters. https://t.co/xSjFldwMmn', 'Tonight, I joined Democrats and Republicans in passing nearly $40B in military, humanitarian, and economic support to our allies in Ukraine. I will continue to #StandWithUkraine and work to ensure the Ukrainian people have the resources they need.
https://t.co/Q6up2y6feZ']

name: Albio Sires
tweets: ['As Western Hemisphere leaders convene this week for the Summit of the Americas, I urge each and every government to redouble their commitment to democracy, human rights, and sustainable development for all. We must set aside our differences to build resilience and prosperity.', 'This Gun Violence Prevention Month, I will continue to advocate for legislation which saves lives. In my weekly newsletter, I outline the policies needed to prevent gun violence: \xa0https://t.co/pga2AaIaBR.', 'This is the only country where this regularly happens because every other country responded to gun violence with legislation. More should have been done before so many innocent people were taken from us, and more must be done before any more lives are lost to gun violence.', 'Today, I wear orange to commemorate the far too many lives we have lost to gun violence in this country. The incidents of the last few weeks are stark reminders of our inaction in the face of violence. Enough is enough. This must be the turning point.', 'This Memorial Day, we honor those who have fallen in service to our country. I am grateful to all members of our armed forces and Veteran’s for their brave service.', 'My heart breaks at this senseless loss of life. I am thinking of the families and loved ones of those killed, and the entire Uvalde community. This should not be happening. School should be a place of learning and growth for our kids, not one of fear and death. https://t.co/CXBQkeXmg0', 'Yesterday, I joined all of my @HouseDem colleagues in approving $28 million supplemental appropriations to address the baby formula shortage crisis and prevent any future shortages which put additional strain on millions of families with young children.', 'Head Start began 57 years ago today as a project to expand access to pre-K as part of LBJ’s War on Poverty. Head Start has proven to improve emotional and behavioral development and educational outcomes, demonstrating that investment in our nation’s children benefits our future.', 'This month, encourage loved ones in need to seek the mental health care they deserve. We must do more to break down the stigma surrounding mental health and increase access to mental health care for all who need it. #MentalHealthMonth', 'Mi declaración sobre la nueva política de la administración hacia Cuba: https://t.co/nKHwKOS8vc']

name: Rep. Elissa Slotkin
tweets: ['I’m co-sponsoring the Ban Corporate PACs Act because Americans should know their elected officials are working for the public and not for themselves. Big corporations have had too much influence in our politics for too long. https://t.co/4TYzLJcRct', 'Americans deserve to know their elected leaders have the public’s best interests at heart and aren’t trying to make a quick buck off their position. My Cryptocurrency Accountability Act will improve transparency & help stop the corruption that erodes confidence in our government.', 'Americans see too many headlines about corrupt dealing by elected officials. As the use of cryptocurrency grows, Members of Congress are already investing – that’s why I’m leading a bipartisan bill to require  disclosure of all crypto holdings & trades. https://t.co/EbBHRXsQcp', 'He’s right, and I hope members can embrace the approach used by my colleagues in the @ProbSolveCaucus: rolling up your sleeves, working across the aisle, and hashing out bipartisan solutions that can actually get signed into law.', 'Third: understanding that decent Republicans and Democrats need each other because, at our best, we make each other’s policies stronger.', 'Van raised 3 great points - First: encouraging our colleagues to represent the best version of their politics (i.e. asking the other side to be decent & empathetic in their own party, not demanding they switch to your side); Second: not asking for everything & getting nothing.', 'And in Congress, we need to work harder on building bipartisan from the ground up that will actually pass.  Passing a perfect bill in the House means little if it has no hope in the Senate. And as Van said, there’s a difference between making a point and making progress.', 'It all starts at the local level, where we need to find ways to bring down the temperature and grow the connective tissue between communities. That means finding things beyond politics that can get us talking to one another to rebuild our relationships and trust.', 'There’s no denying that our politics have become more polarized, with decency and civility in short supply. So this morning, I sat down with @VanJones & @UMich Prof. Morela Hernandez for a panel to talk about how we can counter division with facts and empathy. https://t.co/SAtVbhj29U', 'This year’s conference should be a great event with government and business leaders at all levels. I’ll be sharing updates throughout this week, and can’t wait to get to work.']

name: Rep. Abigail Spanberger
tweets:
['My heart breaks for every family whose lives are upended by gun violence.

It is time for Congress to get serious about delivering for our communities. Lives are on the line.', 'The near-constant news reports — mass shootings in Kentucky, South Carolina, Tennessee, here at home in the Seventh District — will not stop without concrete action.

It is not enough to bring bills to the floor. We must actually pass commonsense gun violence prevention measures.', 'June is Alzheimer’s & Brain Awareness Month 🧠

Millions of Americans — including an estimated 150,000 Virginians — are living with Alzheimer’s disease.

In Congress, I’ll continue to support increased investment in research to #ENDALZ in our Commonwealth and across the country.', '78 years ago, brave American servicemembers stormed the beaches of Normandy to defend our values and liberate Europe from tyranny.

Today, we remember the courage and sacrifice of the heroes of the historic #DDay invasion who furthered the promise of freedom. https://t.co/aR7dYpWgRY', 'My office is committed to helping Virginians, like Andrea, receive timely responses from our government to ensure that owed IRS refunds, Social Security checks, and more are received.

If you’re waiting on backlogged federal benefits, please reach out to us for assistance. https://t.co/4YJMtMIFpu', 'I’m proud that our bipartisan push, named for a retired Virginia police officer, has been introduced in the U.S. Senate.

We are recognizing how the law is blocking retired first responders from accessing a key tax benefit to help pay for health coverage.
https://t.co/RUkq7t1UE0', 'My Speedy Updates Act, which was included in the bipartisan infrastructure law, ensures that high-speed internet networks are built with up-to-date upload and download capabilities.

I am proud to help make universal broadband internet a reality for all Virginians. https://t.co/XbiX0zXTya', 'Today is #NationalGunViolenceAwarenessDay. 

As a mom, I know the worry American parents feel when they send their kids off to school.

My @NewsInTheBurg op-ed:
https://t.co/pL6eRDZQnj', 'Voting for bill after bill after bill is the action we owe to our constituents. 

The American people deserve to know where every Member of Congress stands on these commonsense bills! (8/8)', 'These bills actually becoming law is the only way to respond to the desperate outcries for action from our communities. (7/8)']

name: Tom Suozzi
tweets:

We are better than this. name: Rep. Lauren Underwood
tweets:
['The U.S. ranks last among high-income countries for maternal health outcomes. As a co-founder and co-chair of the Black Maternal Health Caucus, I’m working to end disparities in maternal mortality and save moms’ lives.', 'Menthol masks the harshness of smoking and makes it easier for kids to start smoking and ultimately get addicted. 

I support @US_FDA’s efforts to eliminate menthol cigarettes and protect future generations from addiction — we must end this cycle.', 'The economy is adding good jobs at a record pace, but we need to continue to find ways to bring costs down for working families. 

The COMPETES Act — which I voted to pass the House — would bolster our manufacturing power and address supply chain disruptions.', 'Enough is enough. We must enact commonsense, life-saving legislation passed by the House last year to end our country’s gun violence crisis and protect children and educators at school.', "We must advance evidence-based solutions, like my Black Maternal Health Momnibus Act, to end maternal mortality, so that Black moms don't approach motherhood with fear and dread.

We can transform our maternity care system so everyone can experience joyful parenthood.", 'I’m hearing more than ever before from parents, students, and educators about the urgent need for mental health support in schools. 

I secured $111 million, an almost 700% increase, for school-based mental health programs so young people have the tools they need to thrive.', 'I held Big Oil companies accountable for their price gouging — deliberately keeping production low and gas prices high — by voting to pass the Consumer Fuel Price Gouging Prevention Act.  

This legislation would go after price gouging and provide relief to working families.', 'As we recover from the pandemic, families are experiencing pain at the pump and making tough decisions when it comes to their household budgets. I’m dedicated to lowering costs and fighting inflation for working families. Learn more about my work here: https://t.co/SKoWyc2vvp.', 'Semiconductors are chips that help our everyday electronics work — like phones, computers, and appliances. 

The COMPETES Act, which I voted for and passed the House, would increase domestic production of semiconductors and reduce supply chain disruptions. https://t.co/JHJLtgKdgL', 'Health care is a human right. 

I believe that every person in this country deserves access to affordable, high-quality health care, and it’s this belief that drives me and motivates my work every day.']

name: Rep. Colin Allred
tweets:
['We have to do whatever we can to save lives. Inaction is not an option.

I #WearOrange today because as we honor the lives of those taken from us by gun violence, I refuse to believe there is nothing we can do to prevent these tragedies.

name: Equis Research
tweets:
['We are so proud of the work we have done and there is so much more to come so please check out https://t.co/6on8VmUmUz and let us know what you think!', 'Por supuesto the new site gives us the full functionality we wanted in Spanish & it was important to us that it have full accessibility including enlarge font sizes, contrast sensitivity, and alt text with images.', 'Our old site didn’t encompass all the work we do as a multi-entity organization and now it’s a one stop shop for all our programs from working to create a better understanding of LatinX communities, to leadership development, to fighting disinfo.', 'It has been an incredible few years of growth at Equis going from 1 to 24 employees so guess it’s probably about time for a new website! name: Marqueece Harris-Dawson
tweets:
["I'm so proud of young people leading the way on pushing for gun control⁠—we need your voices! https://t.co/c1eDJUFiaT", "These shooters don't act alone. They have co-conspirators. Namely, those who make it easy for them to get a gun without a background check. Our nation continually bears the unspeakable painful burden of these murders.", 'Join us this Wednesday, May 25th, for the Targeted Local Hire (TLH) Workshop from 6-7 pm at Southwest College. I encourage you to register for this event to learn more about TLH and potential employment with the City of Los Angeles. 

RSVP at https://t.co/74mu9peRwP https://t.co/4FfwcccRQQ', 'For these reasons, I voted no on the settlement.', 'My hope is that we act quickly but think critically. This issue is multifaceted but has its roots in inequality. We must build housing and provide services, but in the long term must tackle the deep structural problems in our society.', 'The settlement does not have the power to force two different areas of government together. If we come together on this issue (and we must) it cannot be a reactive and ill-thought-out response.', 'The @LATimes reports that approximately 76% of people living on the street are dealing with a mental illness, disability, or poor physical health. If this is the case, very few individuals will be housed under the settlement’s logic.', 'How will this solve the problem of housing people that are most in need of housing? This selective approach codifies discrimination and puts those with the least resources at the greatest risk of falling through the cracks.', 'The settlement requires that the County and City house 60% of the houseless population on Skid Row.
One striking element is that the settlement states that housing requirements do not apply to those with mental illnesses, substance abuse, disabilities, or chronic health issues.', 'What gets lost in this type of litigation is both compassion and a logical approach to solve systemic problems. The settlement w/the LA Alliance for Human Rights doesn’t tackle the problems in a sustainable way—nor does it accomplish anything beyond what is already planned.']

name: Senator Alex Padilla
tweets:
['I’ve been fortunate to work with @UFWupdates/@ufwfoundation advocating for farm workers for years, but working alongside them for a day gave me a new appreciation for their difficult work putting food on our tables.

They deserve a pathway to citizenship.
https://t.co/JKf8py3aF0', 'As a father, I’m honored to be named a #Champion4Children in the @Campaign4Kids scorecard.

These past few years have been difficult for all of us — kids especially. Now more than ever, we must invest in a healthier and more sustainable future for our children. https://t.co/9cknwampm4', 'On this day in 1944, Allied troops bravely stormed the beaches at Normandy.

Today, we honor their courage and sacrifice to protect democracy and freedom around the world. #DDay', 'At least four more mass shootings took place in America in just the past 24 hours — including six people killed in Philadelphia and Chattanooga. 

Words are not enough. We must take action now to save lives.', "Yesterday, I experienced a small taste of the demanding work our farmworkers do to keep millions fed across America. Their work is essential to our success.

I won't stop fighting to enact robust immigration reform, & provide them with the pathway to citizenship they have earned. https://t.co/f8mu8lKBdP", 'Honored to work alongside @UFWPresident Teresa Romero and inspired by her tireless advocacy to improve the working conditions of farm workers. https://t.co/0hxBnFHoah', 'RT @UFWupdates: Farm workers across the country invited every single US Senator to spend a day in the fields with them. They deserve fair p…', 'More than 18,000 people in the US have died from gun violence this year — but it doesn’t have to be this way.

I #WearOrange for Uvalde, Buffalo, Laguna Woods, and countless other communities shattered by these tragedies. I won’t stop fighting to pass sensible gun safety laws. https://t.co/QZCEedrPRb', 'As I experienced firsthand, farm workers have one of the hardest jobs in America. They are the backbone of our economy.

I support the Farm Workforce Modernization Act, which would provide a pathway to citizenship for millions of undocumented immigrants who call America home. https://t.co/yRKNDUKvCH', 'Farm workers—and all immigrant essential workers —deserve respect, security & a path to citizenship.

That’s why I introduced the Citizenship for Essential Workers Act to provide a pathway to citizenship for immigrants who worked as essential workers during the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/TaZuWupbwK']

name: Congresswoman Nikema Williams
tweets:
['According to @CBSNewsPoll, 44% of Republicans think that mass shootings are something that we have to learn to live with & accept. That is heartless, shameless and unacceptable.

As the mom of a six-year old, I say ENOUGH IS ENOUGH. We need a future our children can believe in.', 'RT @RepNikema: “There’s no amount of blood or pain or death or suffering that would move this Congress to act."

It is unconscionable that…', "Get some news you can use! I'm in Congress working #ForThePeople, which includes making sure that y'all are up to date with what I'm working on.

Read my May newsletter here ⬇️ 

https://t.co/8lpO3xqmnt

And sign up for future updates ⬇️ 

https://t.co/lybkr3endR https://t.co/JMMkYUwLZP", 'On National Gun Violence Awareness Day, #TeamNikema joins folks all over the country to #WearOrange and remember all of the lives taken by gun violence in this country, and the families and communities affected in this ongoing crisis. https://t.co/8GrPMnmkKB', "As a proud mama to my son Carter, I am honored to have been named a Champion for Children by @Campaign4Kids.

Together with my fellow champions in Congress, we've made the largest investment in our children in a generation. I'm fighting for a future our children can believe in! https://t.co/rG3UUadMVa", 'And:

▪️ Cracking down on "ghost guns" (I co-sponsor HR 3088)
▪️ Allowing victims of gun violence to hold gun manufacturers liable (I co-sponsor HR 2814)

I'm looking forward to the House voting on further steps to prevent gun violence. Now we need the Senate to step up!', "Here's action I support in Congress:

▪️ Stronger background checks (I voted for HR 8 and HR 1446)
▪️ More limits on perpetrators of domestic abuse buying guns (I voted for HR 1620)
▪️ Red flag laws (I co-sponsor HR 2377)
▪️ Banning assault weapons (I co-sponsor HR 1808)", '“There’s no amount of blood or pain or death or suffering that would move this Congress to act."

It is unconscionable that nearly five years after Congressman John Lewis said those words on the Capitol steps, the American people are still waiting for action to end gun violence.', 'Today, on the first day of Gun Violence Awareness Month, our hearts are with another community attacked by gun violence, this time in Tulsa, Oklahoma. We CANNOT accept this constant rhythm of tragedy and violence.', 'RT @RepNikema: 101 years ago, a violent white mob attacked the thriving Black community in the Greenwood District of Tulsa. The racist mob…']

nothing has been done.

Thanks to a federal grant, Gaudenzia's in-patient substance use treatment facility — that will open this summer — will help get pregnant women the treatment and care they need. https://t.co/oQclmpvke3", "It's National Gun Violence Awareness Day.

We can pass common-sense gun legislation. 

We can keep guns out of the hands of people who shouldn't have them. 

We can end gun violence in America. 

We don't have another moment to wait. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/YUn1OUrblG", 'There are solutions to the gun violence epidemic in America - @POTUS laid them out for us tonight. 

No more ifs, ands, or buts. No more inaction. Lives are at stake.

The Senate needs to act NOW. https://t.co/gjhESAkoHZ', "Constantly inspired by the advocacy, drive, and commitment from our young people to fight for what's right. 

I stand with them - students in every school in America deserve to feel safe in their classrooms. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/AbPbuqlbt7", 'RT @POTUS: I’ve got an update on our efforts to bring more infant formula to the United States: We secured another 6.5 million bottles of s…', "Increasing diversity in clinical trials will help us increase diversity in Alzheimer’s research, treatment, and prevention.

Let's find a cure once and for all – together. (4/4)", "We know that Alzheimer’s and other dementias disproportionately affect underrepresented populations.

That's why I introduced the ENACT Act last year that would increase diversity in clinical trial research on Alzheimer’s and dementia. (3/4)

https://t.co/RPoHPsPjKk", 'Currently, 11 million Americans provide unpaid care for people with Alzheimer’s or other dementias. 

And as the number of Americans living with Alzheimer’s continues to rise, the fight to find a cure is paramount. (2/4)']

name: Problem Solvers Caucus
tweets:
['The Problem Solvers Immigration Working Group led by @RepTonyGonzales & @RepCarbajal held a roundtable with experts from @HSI_HQ @BPUnion @Anduriltech ValVerdeCounty to discuss bipartisan solutions for addressing security, capacity & humanitarian issues along the southern border. https://t.co/tqEX8jcmYO', 'This morning, #ProblemSolvers @RepCarbajal & @RepDonBacon joined @NewsNation to discuss our bipartisan efforts to support & invest in policing, fund the CHIPS Act, ease supply chain issues, tackle labor shortages, and fix our legal immigration system. https://t.co/35DBdGaj8t', 'Today, #ProblemSolvers Members sent a letter urging the Administration to postpone ending Title 42, calling for further consultation & coordination to execute a comprehensive plan that ensures a secure, orderly & humane process at the border. More here ⬇️
\xa0https://t.co/vuXJeNIVaP', 'NEWS: Today, the Federal Firefighters Fairness Act passed the House!
\xa0
Endorsed by #ProblemSolvers, this bipartisan legislation gives federal firefighters the same access to benefits and protections as other firefighters who have contracted ailments through their heroic efforts.', 'As the nation kicks off #NationalPoliceWeek, the #ProblemSolvers have endorsed two bipartisan bills aimed at bolstering resources & investments in law enforcement, the Invest to Protect Act & the COPS on the Beat Grant Program Reauthorization & Parity Act. https://t.co/KAbTjM8nZQ', '#ProblemSolvers Co-Chairs @RepJoshG and @RepBrianFitz are urging the Administration and Congressional leadership to take action on commonsense bipartisan priorities. More here ⬇️
https://t.co/ex89eWcneP', 'Last week, Members of the #ProblemSolvers Caucus met with Warsaw’s Mayor, Rafał Trzaskowski. Warsaw has taken in over 300,000 Ukrainian refugees. It’s crucial we continue to support our allies and send the necessary aid they need to defend their countries, democracy, and peace. https://t.co/2f0hdSVgr8', '#ProblemSolvers endorsed the bipartisan Public Health & Border Security Act to keep Title 42 protections in place until the Administration presents a detailed plan to address border security. We must protect our law enforcement, families & communities. https://t.co/MDJdvSJOGp', 'With his departure at the end of this term, we are going to miss Fred. We thank him for his leadership, wish Fred and his family well, and applaud the work that he has accomplished for Michigan and our nation. [3/3]', 'As a Vice-Chair of the Problem Solvers Caucus, Fred is a trusted confidant to many members, a constant voice of reason & has been instrumental to our work taking on complex issues and advancing practical solutions. [2/3]']

name: Nancy Pelosi
tweets:
['Let us honor these brave warriors by carrying on their fight against tyranny and ensuring that the flame of democracy continues to light our path forward for generations to come.', 'As we mark 78 years since the Allied D-Day landings, Americans and all freedom-loving people remain in awe of the heroes who stormed the beaches of Normandy to free millions from the clutches of fascism and return the flame of democracy to Europe. https://t.co/XXIS7O5SEq', "In the middle of Putin's war on democracy, oil & gas companies continue to reap record profits & take advantage of the crisis by giving $41 billion to shareholders. It is unacceptable that Big Oil companies prioritize executives over consumers while families struggle at the pump.", "This week, I was proud to visit San Francisco's Twin Peaks to mark the arrival of Pride Month by illuminating the only pink triangle display in the country.

See what else happened this week with my Medium post, ‘Madam Speaker.’ https://t.co/oJITxrgyeJ", 'As Speaker of the House, it was an honor to welcome Her Excellency @MarinSanna, Prime Minister of the Republic of Finland, to the United States Capitol for a bilateral meeting on Finland’s efforts to join NATO, European security, energy security & the Russian invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/796HuHtp2f', 'Read My Full Statement Marking 33 Years Since the Tiananmen Square Massacre
https://t.co/Dw9qgD21gg', 'We must never be silent on issues of freedom, dignity and democracy – because if we do not speak out against human rights abuses in China due to commercial interests, then we will lose all moral authority to speak out for human rights anywhere else in the world.', 'As we commemorate the heroism of the Tiananmen generation, each of us has a sacred obligation to build a more just, more equal and more democratic future.', 'As the world honors the courage of students, workers and ordinary citizens who peacefully defied the Chinese Communist Party’s oppressive regime, let us renew our vow to keep alive the flame of freedom that burned in their hearts.', 'Today, the image of a lone figure – unyielding before a line of tanks – remains seared in the memory of all democracy-loving people.']

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweets:
['Don’t forget to spend some time taking care of yourself today! Your mental health is extremely important, and it’s ok to prioritize it. 

I’ll be listening to some Wu-Tang Clan to help me take a break.', 'American is in the midst of a gun violence epidemic. We’re experiencing so many senseless deaths. We need common sense gun control to begin to solve this intense public health crisis.', 'Today is the 78th anniversary of D-Day. These veterans are some of the bravest Americans in history, and completed an incredibly dangerous operation that begun the end of the Nazi Regime.', 'It’s a beautiful Monday! I’m excited to get to work and keep working to make sure @POTUS cancels student debt.', 'There’s no room in our nation for white supremacy and conspiracy theories. They’re rooted in hate, racism, islamophobia, antisemitism, and xenophobia. We must condemn these evils.', 'Families are still struggling to find baby formula on shelves. We’re the wealthiest country in the world, yet we’re struggling to 
feed our babies.

We need to end the monopoly on baby formula so our families can feed their babies.', 'I’m an example of why @POTUS must cancel student debt.

Only 2.1% of all American PhDs are Black, and I’m one of them. I took out thousands in student loans to get here. Every student should have the opportunity to further their education without having crushing debt.', 'Chag Sameach! I hope everyone the Jewish community here in NY-16 and around the world has a wonderful Shavuot.', 'On Friday I visited Andrus @AndrusChildren in Yonkers. They’re really making a difference in students’ lives when it comes to mental health support and educational support.

I’m proud to have them in our NY-16 community! https://t.co/oMZfFSyMB8', 'As an educator, I know how terrifying it is to be a teacher right now. I was always checking to make sure I was in the best place to protect my students.

There’s an easier way though, it’s called common sense gun reform.']

name: Congresswoman Julia Brownley
tweets:
['Enough is enough. It’s time for Congress to act to save lives.', 'Sean Adler
Alaina Housley
Mark Meza
Justin Meek
Telemachus Orfanos 
Noel Sparks
Sgt. Ron Helus
Blake Dingman
Kristina Morisette
Cody Coffman
Jake Dunham
Daniel Manrique https://t.co/LvAKk9lpnb', 'At just 15 years old, Hadiya’s life was stolen in a tragic act of gun violence. Today, I #WearOrange in honor of the victims of gun violence including:', 'In 2013, Hadiya Pendleton marched in President Obama’s second inaugural parade. One week later, Hadiya was shot and killed on a playground.
 
In honor of Hadiya’s life, her friends started wearing orange, the color hunters wear in the woods to protect themselves and others.', 'It’s time to pass common-sense gun safety legislation to build better, safer communities for our nation’s children. It’s time to take action to #EndGunViolence. https://t.co/0POWQigmNK', 'On November 7, 2018, our community was forever changed by the loss of 12 innocent lives in the tragedy that unfolded at Borderline Bar & Grill in Thousand Oaks. Over three years later and so many more lives cut short by gun violence, our laws remain the same.', 'As we mark Gun Violence Awareness Day, I am taking a moment to remember those we have lost to the epidemic of gun violence in America.', 'Our nation’s collective mourning continues as we learn more of the lives lost in Tulsa. No one should live in fear of being a victim of gun violence while at work, at school, at home, or anywhere in America. Enough is enough.', 'As a member of the @LGBTEqCaucus, I am committed to supporting the LGBTQ+ community and working to ensure full equality for LGBTQ+ people throughout our country.', 'Everyone deserves to be able to live their lives openly as their true selves. And all people, especially our youth, should be able to live their lives free of harassment, discrimination, and violence.']

name: Alex Wilson Acorn reporter
tweets: ['The Camarillo City Council is done with the public portion of the meeting.🎯', 'Water rates could go up 2% and sewer bills 4% under a plan presented to the Camarillo City Council tonight. A decision on the plan is expected in May', 'The Camarillo City Council had made their final selection on a map for future council elections. It was a slightly altered version of a citizen drawn map selected at the last meeting. It will not force any incumbent councilmembers to run against each other', 'The cafe at the Camarillo library might fade into the sunset. The city council was set to ask for proposals for new companies interested in running it but put off a decision for 60 days. Some councilmembers want to consider new uses for the space', 'DUI arrests were up 9% in Camarillo last year', 'Tennessen said violent crime was way down', "Camarillo Police Chief Eric Tennessen is presenting last year's crime statistics to the city council. Overall there was a 2% rise, mostly dur to a huge jump in catalitic converter thefts", "Covering tonight's Camarillo City Council meeting. A final vote on political redistricting is on the agenda. The council might also take action to find a new operator of the cafe at the library https://t.co/CHXOFVuM0p", 'The meeting has adjourned. Good night Twitter folk!', 'The chosen map was drawn by a member of the public and not the demographer hired by the city']

tweets:

name: Val Demings
tweets:
['I’m laser-focused on protecting Florida’s future and improving the quality of life for all people — that’s what this Senate race is about.', "We're turning Florida blue this November! Don't believe me? Just watch! 

https://t.co/oS4nuonPJ0", 'Growing up as the daughter of a maid and a janitor, I understand what it’s like to live on a budget. I understand what families in Florida are facing in these times of inflation. 

That’s why I’m fighting for change.', 'That’s why I fight so hard for America’s workers. They deserve to make a living wage and support their families. They deserve to have decent benefits. They deserve to have safe working conditions.', 'I know what it means to work hard for a living. My parents were a maid and a janitor. I watched my father go to work seven days a week to keep a roof over our heads.', 'Did you know that when I was 14 years old, I got my first job as a dishwasher at a retirement home? I used my money to help my family with bills and groceries.', 'With senseless, gun violence at an all-time high, we need gun control legislation now more than ever. 

This National Gun Violence Awareness Day, I stand with every victim of gun violence, and I’ll continue to fight for the safety of each American.', 'When I think about this race, I can never forget how I got here. I can never forget about the people who invested in me. I would not be here today to run for the U.S. Senate without them.', 'June is National Immigrant Heritage Month. This month I join all immigrants in celebration of their accomplishments and their courage to pursue the American Dream.', 'Happy #Pride Month to our LGBTQ+ community! I want you to know that you are loved, appreciated and free to be yourself. 

From social work to law enforcement to Congress, I’ve dedicated my life to making communities safer and equitable for all Floridians. https://t.co/tPgjIs4ExP']

Made possible by the #AmericanRescuePlan, these funds are going to help bolster educational endeavors benefiting our entire community.', 'RT @CAPAC: Our nation is one that has been built and molded by the courage and boundless spirit of immigrants from every corner of the glob…', "This #PrideMonth, we celebrate & honor the LGBTQ+ community—your strength, resiliency & authenticity, all which have helped us build a better & brighter world.

name: Congressman Jamaal Bowman
tweets:
['Don’t forget to spend some time taking care of yourself today! Your mental health is extremely important, and it’s ok to prioritize it. 

I’ll be listening to some Wu-Tang Clan to help me take a break.', 'American is in the midst of a gun violence epidemic. We’re experiencing so many senseless deaths. We need common sense gun control to begin to solve this intense public health crisis.', 'Today is the 78th anniversary of D-Day. These veterans are some of the bravest Americans in history, and completed an incredibly dangerous operation that begun the end of the Nazi Regime.', 'It’s a beautiful Monday! I’m excited to get to work and keep working to make sure @POTUS cancels student debt.', 'There’s no room in our nation for white supremacy and conspiracy theories. They’re rooted in hate, racism, islamophobia, antisemitism, and xenophobia. We must condemn these evils.', 'Families are still struggling to find baby formula on shelves. We’re the wealthiest country in the world, yet we’re struggling to 
feed our babies.

We need to end the monopoly on baby formula so our families can feed their babies.', 'I’m an example of why @POTUS must cancel student debt.

Only 2.1% of all American PhDs are Black, and I’m one of them. I took out thousands in student loans to get here. Every student should have the opportunity to further their education without having crushing debt.', 'Chag Sameach! I hope everyone the Jewish community here in NY-16 and around the world has a wonderful Shavuot.', 'On Friday I visited Andrus @AndrusChildren in Yonkers. They’re really making a difference in students’ lives when it comes to mental health support and educational support.

I’m proud to have them in our NY-16 community! https://t.co/oMZfFSyMB8', 'As an educator, I know how terrifying it is to be a teacher right now. I was always checking to make sure I was in the best place to protect my students.

There’s an easier way though, it’s called common sense gun reform.']

name: Charles River Conservancy
tweets: ["We were glad to see many of you at the Newsfeed Cafe on May 26th for Charles River Trivia Night! @bplmaps's trivia series was presented through their current environmental justice exhibition, More or Less in Common: Environment and Justice in the Human Landscape. https://t.co/xxKCIqUR8K", '😍 https://t.co/RS4Yw0GyuI', 'Last week, @Mirakl joined us to paint benches, remove litter, and cut back vegetation in North Point Park and around Lynch Family Skatepark. name: Bill de Blasio
tweets: ['Met two wonderful teachers from MS88 in Brooklyn today. I thanked them for all they have done to make “88’s” (as we say in the neighborhood) the great and beloved school it is. These committed public servants are some of the special people who make #NY10 a beautiful place to live https://t.co/iDzeKuYfSp', 'This morning outside PS 10 in Brooklyn had a great talk with Helen, one of many parents who told me how much they loved their school. There is nothing better these spontaneous and open conversations with the people of #NY10! https://t.co/7D5SLnduCJ', 'A beautiful day in Sunset Park! Hanging out with Jose and Clara. They took a break from their picnic to talk about the neighborhood and sign my petition for #NY10. I worked on behalf of the families of the wonderful Sunset Park community as a School Board member starting in 1999. https://t.co/uj0O6kpbPA', 'On 5th Avenue in Sunset Park today, petitioning for #NY10. Thanks to Maritza who stopped to talk and was kind enough to help me get on the ballot! https://t.co/apRLtHNOSU', 'Hanging out with Andrew Vladeck (otherwise known as \u2066@HopalongAndrew\u2069) who sings cowboy songs about city life in Carroll Park. Thanks for what you do, Andrew! Another one of the really interesting people I’ve met petitioning for #NY10! https://t.co/mLWDmBVmQB', 'When you get a chance to gig with the legendary Huffbunnies, you definitely have to take it! Here’s a snippet of my debut as a washboard player on “Give Me The Moon Over Brooklyn.” Magical things happen in #NY10! 🙂 https://t.co/uvxfLP1yQQ', 'At our annual block party: one of the very best days of each year! For 22 years, Chirlane and I have been blessed to live with a warm and caring group of neighbors. If you ever worry that there is no longer a sense of community in this world, just stop by a Brooklyn block party! https://t.co/nQXumS77vQ', 'At the #RedHookFest petitioning for #NY10. I promised my friend I would spell her name right: R-O-N-D-A. Thanks for helping me get on the ballot, Ronda! Would be an honor to represent you and the entire Red Hook community. https://t.co/5xlA18nW9W', 'Thanks to these wonderful organizers from #RedHookFest for giving the whole neighborhood a beautiful day by the waterfront. Leaders like these help make Red Hook a strong and resilient community. https://t.co/LOhVUlNr5R', 'With my friend Walter at the 6th Street block party today. It’s a really beautiful day to connect with my neighbors and petition for #NY10! https://t.co/VUT3dyPMTy']

But it is. 

And it’s SHAMEFUL.

#GunViolenceAwarenessDay', 'Gun violence deaths SHOULD NOT be the leading cause of death for our children.

name: Rep. Lauren Underwood
tweets:
['The U.S. ranks last among high-income countries for maternal health outcomes. As a co-founder and co-chair of the Black Maternal Health Caucus, I’m working to end disparities in maternal mortality and save moms’ lives.', 'Menthol masks the harshness of smoking and makes it easier for kids to start smoking and ultimately get addicted. 

I support @US_FDA’s efforts to eliminate menthol cigarettes and protect future generations from addiction — we must end this cycle.', 'The economy is adding good jobs at a record pace, but we need to continue to find ways to bring costs down for working families. 

The COMPETES Act — which I voted to pass the House — would bolster our manufacturing power and address supply chain disruptions.', 'Enough is enough. We must enact commonsense, life-saving legislation passed by the House last year to end our country’s gun violence crisis and protect children and educators at school.', "We must advance evidence-based solutions, like my Black Maternal Health Momnibus Act, to end maternal mortality, so that Black moms don't approach motherhood with fear and dread.

We can transform our maternity care system so everyone can experience joyful parenthood.", 'I’m hearing more than ever before from parents, students, and educators about the urgent need for mental health support in schools. 

I secured $111 million, an almost 700% increase, for school-based mental health programs so young people have the tools they need to thrive.', 'I held Big Oil companies accountable for their price gouging — deliberately keeping production low and gas prices high — by voting to pass the Consumer Fuel Price Gouging Prevention Act.  

This legislation would go after price gouging and provide relief to working families.', 'As we recover from the pandemic, families are experiencing pain at the pump and making tough decisions when it comes to their household budgets. I’m dedicated to lowering costs and fighting inflation for working families. Learn more about my work here: https://t.co/SKoWyc2vvp.', 'Semiconductors are chips that help our everyday electronics work — like phones, computers, and appliances. 

The COMPETES Act, which I voted for and passed the House, would increase domestic production of semiconductors and reduce supply chain disruptions. https://t.co/JHJLtgKdgL', 'Health care is a human right. 

I believe that every person in this country deserves access to affordable, high-quality health care, and it’s this belief that drives me and motivates my work every day.']
